name: inconsecutive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Inconsecutive days, events, numbers, etc. do not follow one after another without interruption: The series of novels describe his career in an inconsecutive but neatly planned order. The surveys were conducted on inconsecutive days at each station, at different times throughout the day.
More examplesFewer examplesThe narrative spans fifty years, presented in inconsecutive episodes.School officials contact parents when their kids miss three consecutive days of school or five inconsecutive days.Berries from nine varieties were collected from three growth locations in five inconsecutive years.
